page.title: 10A Special Day At Our School.
page.content: On the 20th June 1985 Durrington Junior School turned the clock back to the Victorian Days.Everybody had to dress up in Victorian Clothes.When we got to school we had to line up in alphabetical order according to our surnames. In our first{Victorian Lesson}Miss Payne came in and showed us how to make a paper serviette.Victorian children used to do this very well but we made a mess of it.Then Mr Bavin (our Headmaster) came in and we had to recite a poem.Later we went outside to Toe The Line,a form of Victorian Punishment.No one dared to step over the line.The penalty was to recite a nursery rhyme. In the afternoon we played Victorian Games and a photographer took pictures of us.We also made and ate some gruel,it was awful.
